member.name: T:Facebook.FacebookAppBase
member.summary: Represents the core Facebook functionality.

member.name: M:Facebook.FacebookAppBase.InvarientObject
member.summary: The code contracts invarient object method.

member.name: M:Facebook.FacebookAppBase.GetLoginUrl
member.summary: Get a Login URL for use with redirects. By default, full page redirect is assumed.
member.returns: The URL for the login flow.

member.name: M:Facebook.FacebookAppBase.GetLoginUrl(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Get a Login URL for use with redirects. By default, full page redirect is assumed. If you are using the generated URL with a window.open() call in JavaScript, you can pass in display=popup as part of the parameters. The parameters: - next: the url to go to after a successful login - cancel_url: the url to go to after the user cancels - req_perms: comma separated list of requested extended perms - display: can be "page" (default, full page) or "popup"
member.returns: The URL for the login flow.

member.name: M:Facebook.FacebookAppBase.GetLogoutUrl
member.summary: Get a Logout URL suitable for use with redirects.
member.returns: The URL for the logout flow.

member.name: M:Facebook.FacebookAppBase.GetLogoutUrl(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Get a Logout URL suitable for use with redirects. The parameters: - next: the url to go to after a successful logout
member.returns: The URL for the login flow.

member.name: M:Facebook.FacebookAppBase.GetLoginStatusUrl
member.summary: Get a login status URL to fetch the status from facebook.
member.returns: The URL for the logout flow

member.name: M:Facebook.FacebookAppBase.GetLoginStatusUrl(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Get a login status URL to fetch the status from facebook. The parameters: - ok_session: the URL to go to if a session is found - no_session: the URL to go to if the user is not connected - no_user: the URL to go to if the user is not signed into facebook
member.returns: The URL for the logout flow

member.name: M:Facebook.FacebookAppBase.CleanUrl(System.Uri)
member.summary: Cleans the URL or known Facebook querystring values.

member.name: M:Facebook.FacebookAppBaseContracts.GetLoginUrl(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Get a Login URL for use with redirects. By default, full page redirect is assumed. If you are using the generated URL with a window.open() call in JavaScript, you can pass in display=popup as part of the parameters. The parameters: - next: the url to go to after a successful login - cancel_url: the url to go to after the user cancels - req_perms: comma separated list of requested extended perms - display: can be "page" (default, full page) or "popup"
member.returns: The URL for the login flow.

member.name: M:Facebook.FacebookAppBaseContracts.GetLogoutUrl(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Get a Logout URL suitable for use with redirects. The parameters: - next: the url to go to after a successful logout
member.returns: The URL for the login flow.

member.name: M:Facebook.FacebookAppBaseContracts.GetLoginStatusUrl(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Get a login status URL to fetch the status from facebook. The parameters: - ok_session: the URL to go to if a session is found - no_session: the URL to go to if the user is not connected - no_user: the URL to go to if the user is not signed into facebook
member.returns: The URL for the logout flow

member.param: The facebook settings for the application.

member.name: M:Facebook.FacebookApp.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with only an access_token set. From this state sessions will not be accessable.

member.name: M:Facebook.FacebookApp.GetLoginUrl(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})

summary.para: Get a Login URL for use with redirects. By default, full page redirect is assumed. If you are using the generated URL with a window.open() call in JavaScript, you can pass in display=popup as part of the parameters.
- next: the url to go to after a successful login
- cancel_url: the url to go to after the user cancels
- req_perms: comma separated list of requested extended perms
- display: can be "page" (default, full page) or "popup"

member.returns: The URL for the login flow.

member.name: M:Facebook.FacebookApp.GetLogoutUrl(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})

summary.para: Get a Logout URL suitable for use with redirects.
- next: the url to go to after a successful logout

member.returns: The URL for the login flow.

member.name: M:Facebook.FacebookApp.GetLoginStatusUrl(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})

summary.para: Get a Logout URL suitable for use with redirects.
- next: the url to go to after a successful logout

member.returns: The URL for the login flow.

member.name: M:Facebook.FacebookApp.WithMirrorRetry(System.Action)
member.summary: This method invokes the supplied delegate with retry logic wrapped around it. No values are returned. If the delegate raises recoverable Facebook server or client errors, then the supplied delegate is reinvoked after a certain amount of delay until the retry limit is exceeded, at which point the exception is rethrown. Other exceptions are not caught and will be visible to callers.
member.param: The delegate to invoke within the retry code.

member.name: M:Facebook.FacebookApp.WithMirrorRetry``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: This method invokes the supplied delegate with retry logic wrapped around it and returns the value of the delegate. If the delegate raises recoverable Facebook server or client errors, then the supplied delegate is reinvoked after a certain amount of delay until the retry limit is exceeded, at which point the exception is rethrown. Other exceptions are not caught and will be visible to callers.
member.typeparam: The type of object being returned
member.param: The delegate to invoke within the retry logic which will produce the value to return
member.returns: The value the delegate returns
